text: in a Brazilian forest scientists are
showing videos to wild marmosets but
it's okay their educational marmosets
are known to be good learners from
laboratory experiments but they like to
learn from members of the family groups
they live in scientists wanted to see if
they could learn from strangers marmoset
said they didn't know since marmosets
are territorial and can get aggressive
to strangers
a scientist tried video they tested a
dozen marmoset family groups each group
stays in its own territory so they
didn't get to peek at what the other
groups were watching on video
some of the marmosets watched a
demonstration of how to get food out of
an experimental apparatus others just
had a video monitor with an unmoving
image the monkeys who saw the
demonstration of how to get food out of
the box did much better than the ones
who had placebo TV many scientists think
this kind of social learning shows
something about how the human ability to
pass on traditions first began to evolve
being able to learn from strangers on
video doesn't mean that marmoset
civilization is right around the corner
but it's pretty impressive
